to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: compiling a new debian kernel
body:
>>>>> "GN" == Gregory Nowak  writes:

    GN> All you really need to do is make config/menuconfig, and then
    GN> make-kpkg kernel_image .
Yes, and if you want initrd then:

make-kpkg --initrd  and for some appendix to kernel name you can use
option --append-to-version SOMETHING.


--
